Key Match Events: Jrue Holiday recorded a hot start with 12 points in the first quarter on 5-of-6 shooting.
Boston Celtics held Houston Rockets to just 36.4 percent shooting from the floor, including 27.8 percent from deep.
Houston Rockets were limited to 86 points, the fewest by any NBA team in a game in nearly three years.
Kristaps Porzingis returned to the lineup and finished with 11 points, five rebounds, two assists, and two blocks.
Pre-Game Insights: Boston Celtics are 17-2 this season when Holiday scores in double digits and 46-2 all-time when he scores at least 14 points.
Coach Mazzulla emphasized the importance of Holiday's aggressiveness on the offensive end to be dynamic and aggressive.
Post-Match Reflections: Mazzulla highlighted how much effort Holiday was giving, running back on defense, and credited him for holding Houston's offense to just 36.4 percent shooting.
Mazzulla praised Porzingis' defense in the second half and noted his contribution in limiting the Rockets to just 30 points in the paint.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Boston Celtics outscored their opponents by 42 points during Holiday's 92 minutes of action.
Boston Celtics faced their toughest challenge of the season in a road game against the 29-5 Oklahoma City Thunder, winners of 14 straight.
